marketNews.title: Trump Ahead in Quick Count, IHSG Under Pressure
marketNews.content: Donald Trump is projected to have secured more than 270 electoral votes and defeated Kamala Harris in the US presidential election, based on quick count results released by Reuters, NBC News, and the New York Times on Wednesday (6/11) local time. In general, Trump outlined a number of protectionist policies that focus more on domestic economic development, including: Lowering the corporate tax rate to 15% (vs. previously: 21%). Imposing import duties of 10-20% on all imported goods. Specifically for China, the import duty imposed will be 60%. In response to the projection of Trump's victory, the US Dollar Index (DXY) strengthened +1.32% to the level of 104.8 today, Wednesday (6/11), while the 10-year US government bond yield rose +12 bps to the level of 4.4%. In Indonesia, news of Trump's victory suppressed the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar, causing it to drop -0.6% to the level of 15,840 today, marking the lowest level in the last 3 months. Meanwhile, the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose +11 bps to the level of 6.85%. It should be noted that the weakening of the exchange rate was also seen in other emerging market currencies, with the Malaysian Ringgit (-1.3%) and the Philippine Peso (-0.58%) also weakening in today's trading. Following the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate since this morning, the Director of Monetary Management and Security Assets at Bank Indonesia, Fitra Jusdiman, said that his office is ready to stabilize the Rupiah exchange rate from volatility. Fitra stated that Bank Indonesia will implement a triple intervention, targeting the foreign exchange spot market, the domestic non-deliverable forward, and the secondary government bond market.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We see that protectionist policies from Trump potentially strengthen the US dollar. Generally, this can negatively affect the IHSG because it triggers outflows from foreign investors, especially for companies that have large exposure (debt/imports) in US dollars. From an economic aspect, protectionist policies from Trump can also negatively affect Indonesia's economic growth, considering the US is the second-largest net export source for Indonesia. In today's trading, Wednesday (6/11), foreign investors recorded a foreign outflow of 1.1 trillion rupiah, with big banks such as BMRI (-5.4%; foreign outflow 583 billion rupiah), BBNI (-5.1%; foreign outflow 132 billion rupiah), and BBRI (-2.3%; foreign outflow 480 billion rupiah) experiencing significant declines. Meanwhile, several issuers with large US dollar debt/imports also experienced declines, such as ICBP (-3.6%), PWON (-5.3%), and MAPI (-5.8%). On the other hand, the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar can narrow the space for Bank Indonesia to lower interest rates. The Bloomberg consensus expects a BI interest rate cut of -25 bps until the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Government Policy Updates
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the government will issue new regulations regarding provincial minimum wage (UMP) in the near future. Airlangga mentioned that the new UMP regulation will adjust the Constitutional Court's decision which partially granted the laborers' demands regarding the employment cluster in the Omnibus Law on Job Creation. Once the UMP determination mechanism is set, the government will revise Government Regulation Number 51 of 2023. The period for determining the UMP itself is due on November 21, 2024, with the announcement schedule for regency/city minimum wages no later than November 30, 2024. The Head of the Indonesia Domestic Investment Authority (BPI Danantara), Muliaman Darmansyah Hadad, said that President Prabowo Subianto will inaugurate BPI Danantara as the new manager of state wealth funds on November 7, 2024. Going forward, BPI Danantara is targeted to become the 4th largest sovereign wealth fund in the world with a managed fund target reaching 982 billion US dollars. In the initial stage, BPI Danantara will receive managed funds amounting to 10.8 billion US dollars sourced from the assets of the Indonesia Investment Authority. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the government is preparing incentives for labor-intensive sectors to prevent layoffs amid declining middle-class numbers and public purchasing power. One of the incentives to be given is an investment credit incentive so that business actors in labor-intensive sectors can purchase machines that are more operationally efficient and have a larger output per unit. The President Director of PT Eramet Indonesia Mining, Jerome Baudelet, said that his company has started lithium exploration studies - which is one of the raw materials for electric vehicle batteries - in Grobogan Regency, Central Java. In the initial stage, PT Eramet Indonesia Mining will focus on obtaining lithium brine samples, which are saline groundwater deposits containing dissolved lithium. The Head of the Kadin Indonesia Public Policy Permanent Committee, Chandra Wahjudi, said that the discourse on extending the deadline for the placement of Export Proceeds (DHE) from natural resources will reduce company liquidity. Chandra also hopes the government can provide new incentives such as access to financing with more competitive interest rates, in addition to fiscal incentives in the form of larger tax reductions. Previously, the government planned to extend the holding period obligation for DHE from natural resources from the current provision which requires exporters to keep 30% of DHE in the domestic financial system for a minimum period of 3 months. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the government is opening the opportunity for additional incentives for exporters who place DHE, although he did not detail the additional incentives to be provided. The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, officially issued Minister of Finance Regulation Number 81 of 2024 concerning taxation in the context of implementing the core taxation system. This regulation governs taxpayer registration, tax payments and deposit, up to the submission method for annual tax returns (SPT). This regulation is effective starting January 1, 2025, and will revoke 42 previous taxation regulations. Bloomberg reported that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) has submitted an investment proposal valued at almost 10 million US dollars in Indonesia. The proposal includes investment in an accessories and gadget component factory in Bandung, West Java, in partnership with its suppliers. This investment proposal was submitted after the Indonesian government banned the sale of the iPhone 16 series, which had not yet met the 40% domestic component level (TKDN). The government previously stated that the TKDN for the iPhone 16 series could not yet be granted because Apple had only realized an investment of 1.5 trillion rupiah, lower than its commitment of 1.7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Secures Rp4 Trillion Mining Services Contract
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea secured mining services contracts worth 4.03 trillion rupiah from PT Bara Prima Mandiri and PT Niaga Jasa Dunia. This contract will run until December 31, 2032, with estimated overburden removal production reaching 135.46 million bcm and coal production of 7.53 million tons.

tickerNews.title: MYOR Expects Gross Profit Margin Recovery in 4Q24 and Beyond
tickerNews.content: MYOR: Mayora Indah management stated in the 3Q24 earnings call on Tuesday (5/11) that the company is optimistic that gross profit margin recovery will start to be seen in 4Q24 and become more noticeable in 1Q25 and 2Q25. This margin recovery will be driven by 3 factors: 1) the continuation of the selling price increase implemented in October 2024; 2) the strengthening of the US Dollar exchange rate against the Rupiah; and 3) raw material stock costs which will begin to decline following commodity price decreases. Previously, MYOR's gross profit margin dropped in 3Q24 to 20.5% (vs. 3Q23: 26.9%, 2Q24: 23.5%), pressured by high raw material costs, especially coffee and cocoa, as well as the weakening of the US Dollar exchange rate negatively impacting the translation of export sales into Rupiah. MYOR management is also optimistic about achieving the FY24 revenue growth guidance of up to +12%, based on strong sales growth in October 2024 (+20% YoY) continuing the momentum from 3Q24 (+17% YoY).

tickerNews.title: NCKL's Third RKEF Smelter to Begin Operations in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Head of Investor Relations at Trimegah Bangun Persada, Lukito Gozali, said that the company's third RKEF smelter project will begin operating in 1Q25, with an initial production capacity of 60,000 tons of ferronickel per year. Eventually, this smelter will reach full capacity of 185,000 tons of ferronickel per year. Previously, NCKL already had 2 RKEF smelters with a total production capacity of 120,000 ferronickel per year. NCKL also operates 2 HPAL smelters with a total production capacity of 120,000 tons of nickel content and 14,250 tons of cobalt content per year.

tickerNews.title: FORU Controlling Shareholder Sells 1.55 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: FORU: The controller of Fortune Indonesia, IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd., sold 1.55 million FORU shares at an average price of 5,073 rupiah per share between October 29 and November 4, 2024. The total transaction value reached 7.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of IMR Asia Holding Pte Ltd in FORU decreased from 77.7% to 77.37%.

tickerNews.title: SCMA to Distribute Rp316.8 Billion Interim Dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: SCMA: Surya Citra Media will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 316.8 billion rupiah, or 5 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 14, 2024, while payment will be made on December 6, 2024. Based on SCMA's stock price at the close of trading on Wednesday (6/11) at 126 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 4%.

tickerNews.title: ASSA to Distribute Rp73.8 Billion Interim Dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: ASSA: Adi Sarana Armada will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 73.8 billion rupiah, or 20 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 14, 2024, while payment will be made on November 22, 2024. Based on ASSA's stock price at the close of trading on Wednesday (6/11) at 725 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.8%.

tickerNews.title: Heidelberg Materials Proposes New President Director for INTP, Replacing David Jonathan Clarke
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa announced that its controller, Heidelberg Materials AG, proposes Sunnira Ly as the new President Director of INTP to replace David Jonathan Clarke who has resigned. This plan will be discussed at the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on December 4, 2024. Currently, Sunnira Ly serves as the Deputy President Director for Finance at Heidelberg Materials Canada.

tickerNews.title: NSSS Shareholder PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama Increases Stake; Controller PT Mitra Agro Dharma Unggul Sells Shares
tickerNews.content: NSSS: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera shareholder, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, purchased 830 million NSSS shares at an average price of 190 rupiah per share on October 29, 2024. The total transaction value reached 158 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama in NSSS increased from 24.55% to 28.03%. In another transaction, the controller of NSSS, PT Mitra Agro Dharma Unggul, sold 734.3 million NSSS shares at an average price of 190 rupiah per share on October 29, 2024. The total transaction value reached 139 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Mitra Agro Dharma Unggul in NSSS decreased from 17% to 13.91%.

tickerNews.title: FAST Closed 47 KFC Outlets in 9M24 Amidst Boycott Pressure
tickerNews.content: FAST: Katadata reported that the operator of Kentucky Fried Chicken (KFC) outlets, Fast Food Indonesia, has closed 47 outlets during 9M24, bringing the total number of outlets to 715 restaurants. Besides closing outlets, FAST also implemented efficiency measures, with employee numbers recorded to have decreased by 2,274 people during 9M24 to 13,715 people. This efficiency occurred alongside the swelling of net losses during 9M24 to 557 billion rupiah (vs. 9M23: net loss 152 billion rupiah) due to boycott pressure.
